message.content:
I'll calculate the requested financial ratios step by step based on the provided financial statements.

## Step 1: Free Cash Flow (FCF)
FCF = Operating Cash Flow - Capital Expenditures
- Operating Cash Flow = -18,924,462.44
- Capital Expenditures (Purchase of Fixed Assets) = 2,670,827.47
- FCF = -18,924,462.44 - 2,670,827.47 = -21,595,289.91

## Step 2: Return on Assets (ROA)
ROA = Net Income / Average Total Assets
- Net Income = 1,842,166.21
- Initial Total Assets = 28,000,000.00
- End Total Assets = 30,858,088.75
- Average Total Assets = (28,000,000.00 + 30,858,088.75) / 2 = 29,429,044.38
- ROA = 1,842,166.21 / 29,429,044.38 = 0.0626 = 6.26%

## Step 3: Return on Equity (ROE)
ROE = Net Income / Average Shareholders' Equity
- Net Income = 1,842,166.21
- Initial Shareholders' Equity = 28,000,000.00
- End Shareholders' Equity = 29,842,166.21
- Average Shareholders' Equity = (28,000,000.00 + 29,842,166.21) / 2 = 28,921,083.11
- ROE = 1,842,166.21 / 28,921,083.11 = 0.0637 = 6.37%

## Step 4: Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio
Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio = Operating Cash Flow / Net Income
- Operating Cash Flow = -18,924,462.44
- Net Income = 1,842,166.21
- Ratio = -18,924,462.44 / 1,842,166.21 = -10.27

## Step 5: Net Profit Margin
Net Profit Margin = Net Income / Total Revenue
- Net Income = 1,842,166.21
- Total Revenue = 20,318,450.67
- Net Profit Margin = 1,842,166.21 / 20,318,450.67 = 0.0907 = 9.07%

## Step 6: Gross Profit Margin
Gross Profit Margin = Gross Profit / Total Revenue
- Gross Profit = 5,718,450.67
- Total Revenue = 20,318,450.67
- Gross Profit Margin = 5,718,450.67 / 20,318,450.67 = 0.2814 = 28.14%
